parameter.name: expirationPolicy
parameter.description: Configures the minimum amount of time that a dynamic configuration instance can remain idle before the runtime considers it eligible for expiration. This does not mean that the platform will expire the instance at the exact moment that it becomes eligible. The runtime will actually purge the instances when it sees it fit.

parameter.name: maxConnections
parameter.description: The maximum number of outbound connections that will be kept open at the same time. By default the number of connections is unlimited.

parameter.name: streamResponse
parameter.description: Whether or not received responses should be streamed, meaning processing will continue as soon as all headers are parsed and the body streamed as it arrives. When enabled, the response MUST be eventually read since depending on the configured buffer size it may not fit into memory and processing will stop until space is available.

parameter.name: responseBufferSize
parameter.description: The space in bytes for the buffer where the HTTP response will be stored.

parameter.name: tlsContext
parameter.description: Protocol to use for communication. Valid values are HTTP and HTTPS. Default value is HTTP. When using HTTPS the HTTP communication is going to be secured using TLS / SSL. If HTTPS was configured as protocol then the user needs to configure at least the keystore in the tls:context child element of this listener-config.

parameter.name: proxyConfig
parameter.description: Http Proxy configuration for the connector

parameter.name: reconnection
parameter.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

parameter.name: maxConnections
parameter.description: The maximum number of outbound connections that will be kept open at the same time. By default the number of connections is unlimited.

parameter.name: streamResponse
parameter.description: Whether or not received responses should be streamed, meaning processing will continue as soon as all headers are parsed and the body streamed as it arrives. When enabled, the response MUST be eventually read since depending on the configured buffer size it may not fit into memory and processing will stop until space is available.

parameter.name: responseBufferSize
parameter.description: The space in bytes for the buffer where the HTTP response will be stored.

parameter.name: tlsContext
parameter.description: Protocol to use for communication. Valid values are HTTP and HTTPS. Default value is HTTP. When using HTTPS the HTTP communication is going to be secured using TLS / SSL. If HTTPS was configured as protocol then the user needs to configure at least the keystore in the tls:context child element of this listener-config.

parameter.name: proxyConfig
parameter.description: Http Proxy configuration for the connector

parameter.name: reconnection
parameter.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

parameter.name: consumerKey
parameter.description: The OAuth consumerKey as registered with the service provider

parameter.name: consumerSecret
parameter.description: The OAuth consumerSecret as registered with the service provider

parameter.name: authorizationUrl
parameter.description: The service provider's authorization endpoint URL

parameter.name: accessTokenUrl
parameter.description: The service provider's accessToken endpoint URL

parameter.name: scopes
parameter.description: The OAuth scopes to be requested during the dance. If not provided, it will default to those in the annotation

parameter.name: resourceOwnerId
parameter.description: The resourceOwnerId which each component should use if it doesn't reference otherwise.

parameter.name: before
parameter.description: The name of a flow to be executed right before starting the OAuth dance

parameter.name: after
parameter.description: The name of a flow to be executed right after an accessToken has been received

parameter.name: listenerConfig
parameter.description: A reference to a <http:listener-config /> to be used in order to create the listener that will catch the access token callback endpoint.

parameter.name: callbackPath
parameter.description: The path of the access token callback endpoint

parameter.name: authorizePath
parameter.description: The path of the local http endpoint which triggers the OAuth dance

parameter.name: externalCallbackUrl
parameter.description: If the callback endpoint is behind a proxy or should be accessed through a non direct URL, use this parameter to tell the OAuth provider the URL it should use to access the callback

parameter.name: objectStore
parameter.description: A reference to the object store that should be used to store each resource owner id's data. If not specified, runtime will automatically provision the default one.

extension.name: Jira
extension.description: The JIRA Rest Connector functions within a Mule application as a secure opening through which you can access - and act upon - your information in Jira.

operation.name: addAttachment
operation.description: Adds one or more attachments to an issue.

parameter.name: issueKeyOrId
parameter.description: The ID or key of the issue that attachments are added to.

parameter.name: attachmentContent
parameter.description: Content of the attachment which will be added to the issue.

parameter.name: fileName
parameter.description: File name of the uploaded attachment

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: responseTimeout
parameter.description: Connection timeout for the request

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

parameter.name: body

operation.name: addWorklog
operation.description:
Adds a worklog to an issue.

Time tracking must be enabled in Jira, otherwise this operation returns an error.

This operation can be accessed anonymously.

Permissions required:

Browse projects and Work on issues project permission for the project that the issue is in. If issue-level security is configured, issue-level security permission to view the issue.

App scope required: WRITE

parameter.name: issueIdOrKey
parameter.description: An ID or key of the issue.

parameter.name: worklogContent
parameter.description: A content of the worklog to be added

parameter.name: notifyUsers
parameter.description: Indicates whether a notification email about the update is sent to all watchers.

parameter.name: adjustEstimate
parameter.description: Defines how to update the issue's time estimate.

parameter.name: newEstimate
parameter.description: Sets the issue's remaining time estimate, for example 2d 4h. Required for Adjust Estimate NEW.

parameter.name: reduceBy
parameter.description: Amount to reduce the issue's remaining estimate by. For example 2d 4h. Required for Adjust Estimate MANUAL.

parameter.name: expandOptions
parameter.description: A list of expand options

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: responseTimeout
parameter.description: Connection timeout for the request

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: assignIssue
operation.description:
Assigns an issue to a user.

Use this operation when the calling user does not have the Edit Issues permission but has the Assign issue permission for the project that the issue is in.

If or accountId is set to:

"-1", the issue is assigned to the default assignee for the project. null, the issue is set to unassigned.

This operation can be accessed anonymously.

Permissions required:

Browse Projects and Assign Issues project permission for the project that the issue is in. If issue-level security is configured, issue-level security permission to view the issue.

App scope required: WRITE

parameter.name: issueKeyOrId
parameter.description: An ID or key of the issue to be assigned.

parameter.name: userAccountId
parameter.description: An account ID of the user, which uniquely identifies the user across all Atlassian products.

parameter.name: responseTimeout
parameter.description: Connection timeout for the request

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: bulkCreateIssue
operation.description:
Creates issues and, where the option to create subtasks is enabled in Jira, subtasks.

Transitions may be applied, to move the issues or subtasks to a workflow step other than the default start step, and issue properties set.

The content of each issue or subtask is defined using update and fields. The fields that can be set in the issue or subtask are determined using the Get create issue metadata. These are the same fields that appear on the issues' create screens. Note that the description, environment, and any textarea type custom fields (multi-line text fields) take Atlassian Document Format content. Single line custom fields (textfield) accept a string and don't handle Atlassian Document Format content.

Creating a subtask differs from creating an issue as follows:

issueType must be set to a subtask issue type (use Get create issue metadata to find subtask issue types). parent the must contain the ID or key of the parent issue.

Permissions required:

Browse projects and Create issues project permissions for the project in which each issue or subtask is created.

App scope required: WRITE

parameter.name: issuesContent
parameter.description: A body of a list of issues to be created.

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: responseTimeout
parameter.description: Connection timeout for the request

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: createIssue
operation.description:
Creates an issue or, where the option to create subtasks is enabled in Jira, a subtask. A transition may be applied, to move the issue or subtask to a workflow step other than the default start step, and issue properties set.

Creating a subtask differs from creating an issue as follows:

issueType must be set to a subtask issue type. parent MUST contain the ID or key of the parent issue.

A parent MAY be supplied for any issue provided both parent and child are members of the same next-gen project. In a classic project the parent field is only valid for subtasks.

Permissions required: Browse projects and Create issues project permissions for the project in which the issue or subtask is created.

App scope required: WRITE

parameter.name: content
parameter.description: A body of an issue to be created.

parameter.name: updateHistory
parameter.description: Indicates whether the project in which the issue is created is added to the user's Recently viewed project list.

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: responseTimeout
parameter.description: Connection timeout for the request

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.description: Creates a link between two issues. Use this operation to indicate a relationship between two issues and optionally add a comment to the from (outward) issue. To use this resource the site must have Issue Linking enabled.Creates an issue type and adds it to the default issue type scheme.

Use this operation to create descriptions of the reasons why issues are linked.

The issue link type consists of a name and descriptions for a link's inward and outward relationships.

To use this operation, the site must have issue linking enabled.

operation.name: createUser
operation.description: Creates a user. This resource is retained for legacy compatibility and will be deprecated once more suitable alternative is available. Include field "password" : "password1234!" to set password a for the user, otherwise it will automatically generated. When using the option not to set but generate a password, include field. "notification" : "true" to ensure the user that their account is created, this email includes a link for the user to set their password. Note that if the notification isn't sent for a generated password, the user will need to be sent a reset password request from Jira.

operation.name: deleteIssue
operation.description:
Deletes an issue.

An issue cannot be deleted if it has one or more subtasks. To delete an issue with subtasks, set deleteSubtasks. This causes the issue's subtasks to be deleted with the issue.

This operation can be accessed anonymously.

Permissions required:

Browse projects and Delete issues project permission for the project containing the issue. If issue-level security is configured, issue-level security permission to view the issue.

App scope required: DELETE

parameter.name: issueKeyOrId
parameter.description: An ID or key of the issue.

parameter.name: deleteSubtasks
parameter.description: Indicates whether the issue's subtasks are deleted when the issue is deleted.

parameter.name: responseTimeout
parameter.description: Connection timeout for the request

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: deleteWorklog
operation.description:
Deletes a worklog from an issue.

Time tracking must be enabled in Jira, otherwise this operation returns an error.

This operation can be accessed anonymously.

Permissions required: Browse projects project permission for the project that the issue is in. If issue-level security is configured, issue-level security permission to view the issue. Delete all worklogs project permission to delete any worklog or Delete own worklogs to delete worklogs created by the user, If the worklog has visibility restrictions, belongs to the group or has the role visibility is restricted to.

App scope required: DELETE

parameter.name: issueIdOrKey
parameter.description: An ID or key of the issue.

parameter.name: worklogId
parameter.description: The ID of the worklog.

parameter.name: notifyUsers
parameter.description: Indicates whether a notification email about the update is sent to all watchers.

parameter.name: adjustEstimate
parameter.description: Defines how to update the issue's time estimate.

parameter.name: newEstimate
parameter.description: Sets the issue's remaining time estimate, for example 2d 4h. Required for Adjust Estimate NEW.

parameter.name: increaseBy
parameter.description: Amount to increase the issue's remaining estimate by. For example 2d 4h. Required for Adjust Estimate MANUAL.

parameter.name: responseTimeout
parameter.description: Connection timeout for the request

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: findGroups
operation.description: Returns a list of groups whose names contain a query string. A list of group names can be provided to exclude groups from the results. The list returns with the groups sorted. If no groups match the list criteria, an empty list is returned.

parameter.name: query
parameter.description: The string to find in group names.

parameter.name: excludeOptions
parameter.description: A group to exclude from the result. Provide only values without keys or ampersands.

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

operation.name: getAllProjectVersions
operation.description: Returns all versions in a project.

parameter.name: projectIdOrKey
parameter.description: The project ID or project key (case sensitive).

parameter.name: pageSize
parameter.description: The maximum number of items to return per page. The maximum is 50.

parameter.name: orderBy
parameter.description: Order the results by one of the following fields: description, issueCount, lead ane name.

parameter.name: query
parameter.description: Filter the results using a literal string. Projects with a matching key or name are returned (case insensitive).

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: A list of status values used to filter the results by version status. This parameter accepts a comma-separated list. The status values are released, unreleased, and archived.

parameter.name: expandOptions
parameter.description: List of expand options to include additional information in the response.

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: getAllProjects
operation.description: Returns projects visible to the user.

parameter.name: pageSize
parameter.description: The maximum number of items to return per page. The maximum is 50.

parameter.name: orderBy
parameter.description: Order the results by one of the following fields: description, issueCount, lead ane name.

parameter.name: query
parameter.description: Filter the results using a literal string. Projects with a matching key or name are returned (case insensitive).

parameter.name: typeKey
parameter.description: Orders results by the project type. This parameter accepts a comma-separated list. Valid values are business, service_desk, and software.

parameter.name: categoryId
parameter.description: The ID of the project's category. A complete list of category IDs is found using the Get all project categories operation.

parameter.name: searchBy
parameter.description: Parameter to describe search criteria. Default: key, name

parameter.name: action
parameter.description: Filter results by projects for which the user can view, browse or edit the project. Default: view

parameter.name: expandOptions
parameter.description: List of expand options to include additional information in the response.

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: responseTimeout
parameter.description: Connection timeout for the request

parameter.name: target

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy

operation.name: getAllWorklogs
operation.description:
Returns all worklogs for an issue.

Time tracking must be enabled in Jira, otherwise this operation returns an error. For more information, see Configuring time tracking.

This operation can be accessed anonymously.

Permissions required: Workloads are only returned where the user has Browse projects project permission for the project that the issue is in. If issue-level security is configured, issue-level security permission to view the issue. If the worklog has visibility restrictions, belongs to the group or has the role visibility is restricted to.

App scope required: READ

parameter.name: issueIdOrKey
parameter.description: An ID or key of the issue.

parameter.name: pageSize
parameter.description: The maximum number of items to return per page. The maximum is 1048576.

parameter.name: startedAfter
parameter.description: The worklog start date and time, in UNIX timestamp format, after which worklogs are returned.

parameter.name: expandOptions
parameter.description: A list of expand options

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: responseTimeout
parameter.description: Connection timeout for the request

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: getIssue
operation.description:
Returns the details for an issue.

The issue is identified by its ID or key, however, if the identifier doesn't match an issue, a case-insensitive search and check for moved issues is performed. If a matching issue is found its details are returned. The issue key returned in the response is the key of the issue found.

This operation can be accessed anonymously.

Permissions required:

Browse projects project permission for the project that the issue is in. If issue-level security is configured, issue-level security permission to view the issue.

App scope required: READ

parameter.name: issueKeyOrId
parameter.description: An ID or key of the issue.

parameter.name: fields
parameter.description: A list of fields to return for the issue.

parameter.name: fieldsByKeys
parameter.description: Indicates whether fields in fields are referenced by keys rather than IDs.

parameter.name: expandOptions
parameter.description: A list of expand options.

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.description:
Returns a status. The status must be associated with a workflow to be returned.

If a name is used on more than one status, only the status found first is returned. Therefore, identifying the status by its ID may be preferable.

operation.description: Returns information about user

parameter.name: accountId
parameter.description: The accountId of the user, which uniquely identifies the user across all Atlassian products, this field is required.

parameter.name: expandOptions
parameter.description: List of expand options to include additional information about users in the response. Expand options include: - "groups" includes all groups and nested groups to which the user belongs. - "applicationRoles" includes details of all the applications to which the user has access.

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

operation.name: getUsersAssignableToIssues
operation.description:
Returns a list of users that can be assigned to an issue. Use this operation to find the list of users who can be assigned to:

- A new issue, by providing the projectKeyOrId. - An updated issue, by providing the issueKey. - To an issue during a transition (workflow action), by providing the issueKey and the transition id in actionDescriptorId, you can obtain the IDs of an issue's valid transitions using the transitions option in the expand parameter of Get issue. - In all these cases, you can pass an accountId to determine if a user can be assigned to an issue.

parameter.name: sessionId
parameter.description: The sessionId of this request. SessionId is the same until the assignee is set.

parameter.name: actionDescriptorId
parameter.description: The ID of the transition.

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: responseTimeout
parameter.description: Connection timeout for the request

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: getUsersAssignableToProjects
operation.description:
Returns a list of users who can be assigned issues in one or more projects.

The list may be restricted to users whose attributes match a string.

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: responseTimeout
parameter.description: Connection timeout for the request

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: getUsersInGroup
operation.description: Returns all users in a group. Note that users are ordered by username, however the username is not returned in the results due to privacy reasons.

parameter.name: groupName
parameter.description: The name of the group.

parameter.name: includeInactiveUsers
parameter.description: Include inactive users.

parameter.name: pageSize
parameter.description: The maximum number of items to return per page. The maximum is 50.

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: responseTimeout
parameter.description: Connection timeout for the request

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: getVersion
operation.description: Returns the project details for a project.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: The ID of the version.

parameter.name: expandOptions
parameter.description: List of expand options to include additional information in the response.

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: target

operation.name: getWorklog
operation.description:
Returns a worklog.

Time tracking must be enabled in Jira, otherwise this operation returns an error.

This operation can be accessed anonymously.

Permissions required:

Browse projects project permission for the project that the issue is in. If issue-level security is configured, issue-level security permission to view the issue. If the worklog has visibility restrictions, belongs to the group or has the role visibility is restricted to.

App scope required: READ

parameter.name: issueIdOrKey
parameter.description: An ID or key of the issue.

parameter.name: worklogId
parameter.description: The ID of the worklog.

parameter.name: expandOptions
parameter.description: A list of expand options

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: responseTimeout
parameter.description: Connection timeout for the request

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: jqlSearch
operation.description: Searches for issues using JQL.

parameter.name: jql
parameter.description: A JQL expression.

parameter.name: pageSize
parameter.description: The maximum number of items to return per page. The default is 50 and the maximum is 100.

parameter.name: properties
parameter.description: A list of up to 5 issue properties to include in the results.

parameter.name: fields
parameter.description: A list of fields to return for each issue.

parameter.name: expandOptions
parameter.description: A list of expand fields. Use expand to include additional information about issues in the response.

parameter.name: validateQuery
parameter.description: Determines how to validate the JQL query and treat the validation results.

parameter.name: fieldsByKeys
parameter.description: Reference fields by their key (rather than ID). The default is false.

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: responseTimeout
parameter.description: Connection timeout for the request

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: notify
operation.description:
Creates an email notification for an issue and adds it to the mail queue.

Permissions required:

Browse Projects project permission for the project that the issue is in. If issue-level security is configured, issue-level security permission to view the issue.

App scope required: WRITE

parameter.name: issueKeyOrId
parameter.description: An ID or key of the issue to be assigned.

parameter.name: notificationContent
parameter.description: Details about a notification.

parameter.name: responseTimeout
parameter.description: Connection timeout for the request

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: searchUsers
operation.description: Returns a list of users that match the provided search string and property. This API is designed to return a small number of users with a flexible search query. As such, the sum of startAt and maxResults must be less than 1000. If the sum is greater, only results up to the 1000th result will be returned.

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: responseTimeout

parameter.name: target

parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: unauthorize
operation.description: Deletes all the access token information of a given resource owner id so that it's impossible to execute any operation for that user without doing the authorization dance again

parameter.name: resourceOwnerId
parameter.description: The id of the resource owner which access should be invalidated

operation.name: updateComponent
operation.description: Updates a component. Any fields included in the request are overwritten. If leadAccountId is an empty string ("") the component lead is removed.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: The ID of the component.

parameter.name: updateComponentContent
parameter.description: Details about a project component.

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: responseTimeout
parameter.description: Connection timeout for the request

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: updateIssue
operation.description:
Edits an issue. A transition may be applied and issue properties updated as part of the edit.

The edits to the issue's fields are defined using update and fields. Note that the description, environment, and any textarea type custom fields (multi-line text fields) take Atlassian Document Format content. Single line custom fields (textfield) accept a string and don't handle Atlassian Document Format content.

This operation can be accessed anonymously.

Permissions required:

Browse projects and Edit issues project permission for the project that the issue is in. If issue-level security is configured, issue-level security permission to view the issue.

App scope required: WRITE

parameter.name: issueKeyOrId
parameter.description: An ID or key of the issue.

parameter.name: content
parameter.description: An issue update details.

parameter.name: notifyUsers
parameter.description: Indicates whether a notification email about the update is sent to all watchers.

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: responseTimeout
parameter.description: Connection timeout for the request

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: updateWorklog
operation.description:
Updates a worklog.

Time tracking must be enabled in Jira, otherwise this operation returns an error.

This operation can be accessed anonymously.

Permissions required:

Browse projects project permission for the project that the issue is in. If issue-level security is configured, issue-level security permission to view the issue. Edit all worklogs project permission to update any worklog or Edit own worklogs to update worklogs created by the user. If the worklog has visibility restrictions, belongs to the group or has the role visibility is restricted to.

App scope required: WRITE

parameter.name: issueIdOrKey
parameter.description: An ID or key of the issue.

parameter.name: worklogId
parameter.description: The ID of the worklog.

parameter.name: worklogContent
parameter.description: A content of the worklog update

parameter.name: notifyUsers
parameter.description: Indicates whether a notification email about the update is sent to all watchers.

parameter.name: adjustEstimate
parameter.description: Defines how to update the issue's time estimate.

parameter.name: newEstimate
parameter.description: Sets the issue's remaining time estimate, for example 2d 4h. Required for Adjust Estimate NEW

parameter.name: expandOptions
parameter.description: A list of expand options

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: responseTimeout
parameter.description: Connection timeout for the request

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

parameter.name: host
parameter.description: Host where the proxy requests will be sent.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: Port where the proxy requests will be sent.

parameter.name: username
parameter.description: The username to authenticate against the proxy.

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: The password to authenticate against the proxy.

parameter.name: nonProxyHosts
parameter.description: A list of hosts against which the proxy should not be used.

parameter.name: ntlmDomain
parameter.description: The domain to authenticate against the proxy.
